translated: Verses of the Elders 6.1
Verses of the Elders🔽The Collection of Elevens
The First Chapter
Uruveḷakassapa
Having seen the miracles
of the famous Gotama,
I did not bow down to him then,
deceived by my pride.🔽The Leader of Men, knowing my thought,
rebuked me;
Then I was overcome with fear,

analyzed: abbhutaḥ loma hasanaḥ  pubbe jaṭila bhūtassa
translated: astonished, my hair stood on end.🔽The little success I had

original: yā me siddhi parittikā;🔽Tāhaṁ tadā nirākatvā,
analyzed: yā me siddhi parittikā  tāḥ aham tadā nirākatvā
translated: when I was a matted-hair ascetic,🔽I abandoned it then
and went forth in the Jina’s Dispensation.
Previously I was content with sacrifice,
with the sense-sphere foremost;
Afterwards I destroyed
passion, hatred, and delusion.
I know my past lives,
the divine eye is purified;
I have supernormal power, I know the minds of others,
and I have attained the divine ear.
The purpose for which I went forth
from the home to the homeless life,
that purpose has been attained by me,
the destruction of all the fetters.
… the Elder Uruveḷakassapa …
